required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role and Mechanism of O-GlcNAc Glycosylation Modified HAS2 in the Hyaluronic Acid Synthesis in ARDS
clinical_study.official_title: The Role and Mechanism of O-GlcNAc Glycosylation Modified HAS2 in the Hyaluronic Acid Synthesis in ARDS

brief_summary.textblock: Maintaining the normal function of the pulmonary microvascular barrier is critical for ARDS treatment. To assess the relationship between the HAS2 protein level, HA content and the clinical prognosis of ARDS in patients with ARDS. Compare the HAS2 protein levels, HMW-HA and LMW-HA levels, endothelial injury indicators, and lungs in the blood of severe and non-ARDS severe patients and healthy adults admitted to the ICU. The correlation between permeability, disease severity and prognosis to explore the predictability of HAS2-HA on the clinical outcome of ARDS.

primary_outcome.description: 28-day mortality (patients will be followed for 28 days)
90-day mortality (patients will be followed for 90 days)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 4 week
through study completion, an average of 4 week
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of the total number of deaths from all causes of the enrolled patients during ICU hospitalization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion，an average of 4 week
primary_outcome.description: successful weaning defined as the absence of the requirement for ventilatory support, without reintubation

primary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood HMW-HA and LMW-HA levels
primary_outcome.description: ELISA method to separate and detect HMW-HA and LMW-HA levels（Units of Measure unit nM/ml）

primary_outcome.measure: HAS2 protein content in peripheral blood
primary_outcome.description: ELISA method detects HAS2 protein in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.measure: ENOS, ET-1, vWF levels in peripheral blood
secondary_outcome.description: ELISA method to detect eNOS, ET-1, vWF in peripheral blood to evaluate endothelial cell damage（Measure unit ng/ml）

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of bound mucinoglycans-1, nitric oxide, and acetylheparin sulfate in peripheral blood
secondary_outcome.description: glycocalyx levels of the endothelium were assessed by measuring the levels of mucin polysaccharide-1, nitric oxide and acetyl heparan sulfate in peripheral blood by ELISA assay（Measure unit ng/ml）

secondary_outcome.measure: In peripheral blood, IL-1α, IL-6, neutrophils, lymphocytes, descending Procalcin, C-reactive protein value
secondary_outcome.description: The ELISA method detects IL-1α and IL-6 in the blood, and records the blood neutrophils, lymphocytes, and vary in procalcin and C-reactive protein to assess the inflammatory response of ARDS(Measure unit pg/ml）

arm_group.description: 1.85 years≥Age≥18 years. 2.Moderate-to-severe ARDS, defined by the ARDS Definition Task Force in the Berlin definition (partial pressure of arterial oxygen [PaO2]:FiO2 ratio ≤200 mmHg with a PEEP ≥5 cmH2O). 3.Diagnosis of ARDS less than 72 hours. 4.Just observation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Critically ill patients without ARDS group
arm_group.description: Unstable vital signs, rapid changes in the condition, unstable function of more than two organ systems (excluding the respiratory system), decline or failure, the development of the disease may endanger the life of the patient.
Healthy adults, voluntarily join the study.

study_pop.textblock:
1.85 years≥Age≥18 years. 2.Moderate-to-severe ARDS, defined by the ARDS Definition Task Force in the Berlin definition (partial pressure of arterial oxygen [PaO2]:FiO2 ratio ≤200 mmHg with a PEEP ≥5 cmH2O).
3.Diagnosis of ARDS less than 72 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1.85 years≥Age≥18 years. 2.Moderate-to-severe ARDS, defined by the ARDS Definition Task Force in the Berlin definition (partial pressure of arterial oxygen [PaO2]:FiO2 ratio ≤200 mmHg with a PEEP ≥5 cmH2O).
3.Diagnosis of ARDS less than 72 hours.
Exclusion Criteria:
All patients who meet any of the following criteria will be excluded at enrollment and randomization.
1. Severe chronic respiratory diseases requiring long-term home oxygen therapy or noninvasive MV.
2. Undrained pneumothorax or subcutaneous emphysema.
3. Severe neuromuscular disease.
4. Hemodynamic instability (>30% increase in vasopressors within 6 hours or norepinephrine >0.5 ug/kg/min) (Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2020; 201(2):178-187) .
5. Contraindications to hypercapnia, such as intracranial hypertension or acute coronary syndrome.
6. Severe other organs dysfunction with a low expected survival (7 days) or palliative care.
7. Solid organ or hematologic tumors with the expected survival time less than 30 days.
8. Participating in other clinical trials within 30 days.
9. Pregnancy.
10. Refusal to sign the informed consent.
